citation.biblCit: Comeau, Louise; Beckley, Thomas; Parkins, John; Stedman, Richard, 2015, "Energy Literacy Survey", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10302, UAL Dataverse, V3, UNF:6:zfWecMfWmGQzVnlespxwGA== [fileUNF]

stdyInfo.abstract: This study contains the questionnaire, datasets and related analysis from a national survey of energy literacy and energy citizenship in Canada, conducted in November 2014.

Need to be self-sufficient/'Not have to import energy

var.name: q14_0
var.labl: [q14.0] How much do you know about the following home and transportation energy use options? | Ways to conserve energy in my home (that is, use less energy overall)

var.name: q24_0
var.labl: [q24.0] Please indicate whether you agree or disagree with the following statements. | I believe that humans are members of the earth’s community of life along with all other living things

var.name: q24_1
var.labl: [q24.1] Please indicate whether you agree or disagree with the following statements. | A first consideration of any good political system is the protection of private property rights

var.name: q24_2
var.labl: [q24.2] Please indicate whether you agree or disagree with the following statements. | I believe that humans, along with all other species, are dependent on the environment and one another to live well

var.name: q24_3
var.labl: [q24.3] Please indicate whether you agree or disagree with the following statements. | We attach too much importance to economic measures of well-being in our society

var.name: q24_4

var.name: q24_7

var.name: q25_2

var.name: q25_3

var.name: q25_4

var.name: q26a_0
var.labl: [q26a.0] We need to find ways to develop untapped resources for renewable energy

var.name: q26a_1
var.labl: [q26a.1] Most Canadians are well aware of the environmental impacts of energy development

var.labl: [q26a.2] Current trends in energy consumption are clearly unsustainable and must be reduced immediately

var.labl: [q26a.3] Small and distributed energy sources are more resilient than centralized production

var.labl: [q26a.4] Canada’s commitment to democracy makes it an ethical supplier of energy

var.name: q26a_5

var.labl: [q26b.2] The current fad for going green will accomplish nothing

var.name: q26b_3
var.labl: [q26b.3] A high level of energy consumption is part of the good life

var.name: q27
var.labl: [q27] To the best of your knowledge, what percentage of the total electrical supply does hydroelectricity provide to your province/territory?

var.name: q28
var.labl: [q28] How sure are you about your response?

var.name: q29
var.labl: [q29] To the best of your knowledge, which of the following requires the <u>LEAST ENERGY</u> in the average Canadian home in one year?

var.name: q30
var.labl: [q30] How sure are you about your response?

var.name: q31
var.labl: [q31] To the best of your knowledge, it is <u>impossible</u> to...

catgry.labl: Save energy by reducing, refusing, and recycling products
Build a machine that produces more energy than it uses
Convert chemical energy to heat energy
Use ethanol to power an automobile
Measure the amount of energy in foods

var.name: q32
var.labl: [q32] How sure are you about your response?

var.name: q33
var.labl: [q33] Which one of the following statements best describes 'renewable energy resources' to you?

catgry.labl: Resources that are free and convenient to use
Resources that are very efficient to use for producing energy
Resources that do not produce air pollution
Resources that can be converted directly into heat and electricity
Resources that are in continuous supply or can be replenished by nature in a short period of time

var.name: q34
var.labl: [q34] How sure are you about your response?

var.name: q35
var.labl: [q35] To the best of your knowledge, what does it mean to you if an electric power plant is 35% efficient?

catgry.labl: For every 35 units of energy that go into the plant, 100 units of electrical energy are produced
For every 100 units of energy that go into the plant, 35 units are converted into electrical energy
For every $100 invested in the production of energy, $35 is made into profit
For every $35 invested in the production of energy, $100 is made into profit
For every 100 units of energy that go into the plant, 35 units are lost during energy transformation

var.name: q36
var.labl: [q36] How sure are you about your response?

var.name: nb1
var.labl: [nb1] Four years ago, the province of New Brunswick proposed selling NB Power to Hydro Quebec. The proposal was abandoned. Do you believe that if the sale of NB Power to Hydro Quebec had gone forward that you, as an energy consumer, would be…

var.name: nb2
var.labl: [nb2] Do you believe that if the sale of NB Power to Hydro Quebec had gone forward that New Brunswick, as a province, would be…

var.name: nb3
var.labl: [nb3] How much do you know about the discussions regarding the future of the Mactaquac Hydroelectric Generating Station?

var.name: nb4
var.labl: [nb4] The province needs to make a decision regarding the future of the Mactaquac Hydroelectric Generating Station in the next four to five years. The dam is located 20km upstream from the City of Fredericton. Currently, this 660 MW facility generates abo

catgry.labl: Retain the dam and the reservoir (head pond) behind it, without electricity generation capacity
Rebuild the dam with the same or more electrical generation capacity

var.name: nb5_0
var.labl: [nb5.0] In thinking about the province’s options for the Mactaquac Hydroelectric Generating Station, please indicate how important the following were in influencing your answer. | Impact on the environment

var.name: nb5_2
